headline: Leidos, Blink Charging, Bloom Energy, Tecnoglass, and Builders FirstSource Shares Plummet, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the after-market session after an unexpectedly sharp rise in wholesale inflation fueled concerns about rising costs and their impact on corporate profits. The primary catalyst was the July 2025 Producer Price Index (PPI), a measure of inflation at the wholesale level, which jumped 0.9% against forecasts of a 0.2% rise. This represents the most significant monthly increase in over three years, pointing to mounting cost pressures for manufacturers, with tariffs cited as
